subject: Re: [junit] TestNG 4 and Data Providers
msgSnippet: ... Fair enough. Besides, if the test failed on build or continuous integratino server ... Actually, TestNG automates that since it generates a
messageBody:
On 10/12/05, Eugene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
>
> Cédric Beust ? wrote:
>
>
> Don't you think it would be a mistake to tell the users how they
> should work? :-)


Fair enough.

Besides, if the test failed on build or continuous integratino server
> you would have to rerun test locally with your breakpoint, which would
> be quite waste of time in my opinion, because you should know that is
> failed from the report.


Actually, TestNG automates that since it generates a testng-failed.xml which
you can then feed to TestNG to rerun only those tests that failed.

Another quite practical use case for test names is that they can be
> potentially used to get better understanding what part of the
> functionality is broken. Especially if this feature is used for some
> integration-level regression tests that may potentially cover wide range
> of functionality.


Okay. I'm not ruling data provider names out, I just decided to start simple
and see what users will do with this feature and find out if it's really
going to be an issue or not.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
